description: From Latin dēpōnēns (“laying aside”), the present active participle of dēpōnō (“lay aside”), from dē- + pōnō (“put, place”). The name comes from the idea that such verbs were originally reflexive and then later "laid aside" their passive meanings.

entries.meaning: (grammar, of a verb) Having passive grammatical form (that is, conjugating like the passive voice), but an active meaning.
(law) A witness; especially one who gives information under oath, in a deposition concerning facts known to him or her.
